intro: Panopsis roldosii, commonly known as the Roldosii panicle. It is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America, specifically Ecuador. This species belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. Panopsis roldosii is characterized by its branched inflorescence and small, delicate flowers that bloom in late spring. It is a relatively rare plant, often found in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests.
